DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Institution Participation Institutional Review Board Approval Status Code ReviewBoardApprovalStatus
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The act of taking part in an activity._A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that describes the state of submission and associated review board decision.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Protocol Institution Participation Institutional Review Board Approval Status Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The act of taking part in an activity._A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The act of taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
The act of taking part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Institutional Review Board Approval Status Code
Property.preferredDefinition: A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
A condition or state at a particular time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the state of submission and associated review board decision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory.:Referred for judgment or consideration; handed over.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Requirement; something that is necessary.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:Referred for judgment or consideration; handed over.

Concepts.definition: Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refuse to accept, recognize or acknowledge.:Referred for judgment or consideration; handed over.

Concepts.definition: Refuse to accept, recognize or acknowledge.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Immunity from an obligation or duty.:Referred for judgment or consideration; handed over.

Concepts.definition: Immunity from an obligation or duty.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.:Referred for judgment or consideration; handed over.

Concepts.definition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
